name: Application security (FAST)
description: Fastest way to learn web application security and DevSecOps

children.name: Foundational Knowledge
children.description: Understand how the internet and modern apps work before touching security.

children.name: Internet Fundamentals
children.description: How the Web works, DNS, HTTP request/response, TLS basics.

children.name: Application Architecture
children.description: Front end ↔ back end ↔ database, build pipelines, cloud hosting, logging.

children.name: Website Components
children.description: User inputs, cookies & sessions, login/logout, service accounts, DB connections.

children.name: Programming Foundations
children.description: Learn to automate—vital for testing, parsing logs, and later exploit development.

children.name: Python Core
children.description: Variables, loops, functions, error handling, virtual environments.

children.name: Bash Essentials
children.description: Pipelines, grep/sed/awk, cron jobs, shell variables.

children.name: Git & Version Control
children.description: git init/clone, branching, pull requests, resolving merge conflicts.

children.name: Project – Log Analyzer
children.description: Write a Python script that ingests Apache logs and outputs top 10 IPs, paths, and error codes.

children.name: Security Basics
children.description: Learn core vulnerabilities and the must-have tooling.

children.name: OWASP Top 10
children.description: High-level overview of SQLi, XSS, IDOR, BAC, Command-i, etc., plus mitigations.

children.name: Burp Suite
children.description: Proxy, Repeater, Intruder, extensions; decode & tamper JWTs with jwt.io.

children.name: Web App Security
children.description: Hands-on exploitation and defence of the most common web flaws.

children.name: SQL Injection
children.description: Use sqlmap, understand prepared statements & ORM protections.

children.name: Cross-Site Scripting
children.description: Reflected, stored, DOM; defend with output encoding & CSP.

children.name: CSRF
children.description: Synchroniser tokens, SameSite cookies, double-submit patterns.

children.name: Command Injection
children.description: Detect unsanitised system calls; mitigate with whitelists & exec wrappers.

children.name: File Upload Abuse
children.description: Bypass file-type filters; defend with MIME checks & AV scanning.

children.name: Identity & Access
children.description: Control who can do what—and break weak implementations.

children.name: AuthN vs. AuthZ
children.description: OAuth2/OIDC flows, JWT claims, RBAC vs. ABAC.

children.name: IDOR & Rate Limiting
children.description: Find insecure object references, fuzz IDs, test throttling controls.

children.name: Hands-On Practice
children.description: Prove skills on safe playgrounds and real code.

children.name: PortSwigger Labs
children.description: Complete some Web Security Academy fundamentals & practitioner labs.

children.name: Build & Host App
children.description: Generate a Flask/Node demo with ChatGPT and deploy to Render/Fly.io.

children.name: Automation & DevOps
children.description: Bring security into version control and pipelines.

children.name: GitHub Automation
children.description: Clone → branch → PR; add Actions with Semgrep SAST & secret-scanning, triage findings.

children.name: CI/CD DevSecOps
children.description: Harden builds and fail deployments on critical issues.

children.name: Pipeline Threats
children.description: Poisoned dependencies, malicious commits, compromised runners.

children.name: Secrets Management
children.description: Vaults, masked vars, short-lived tokens.

children.name: Pre-Commit Hooks
children.description: Secrets scanning, linters, commit-msg policies.

children.name: Supply-Chain Scans
children.description: Run SAST, SCA, IaC & container scans on every PR.

children.name: SBOM & Signing
children.description: Generate CycloneDX and sign images with Sigstore/Cosign.

children.name: Release Gates
children.description: Block deploys on critical findings.

children.name: Secure SDLC
children.description: Embed security across the software-delivery lifecycle.

children.name: SSDLC Phases
children.description: Plan → Design → Build → Test → Release → Operate → Retire, with mapped controls.

children.name: Testing Ecosystem
children.description: What SAST, DAST, and SCA do; open-source supply chain & SBOM basics.

children.name: Container Security
children.description: Write Dockerfile, push image, scan with Trivy/Grype.

children.name: Threat Modeling
children.description: Think like an attacker before code is written.

children.name: House-Plan Exercise
children.description: Ask: What is it? What could go wrong? What will we do? Apply to your house plan, without doors, locks and windows.

children.name: Cheat-Sheet Mitigations
children.description: Use OWASP cheat-sheets for validation, encoding, CSP, rate-limiting.

children.name: Continuous Learning
children.description: Stay current and build reputation.

children.name: Bug-Bounty Write-Ups
children.description: Read HackerOne Hacktivity, Bugcrowd Kudos, Intigriti disclosures daily.

children.name: Security Blogs & Reports
children.description: Follow TL;DR Sec, breach post-mortems, Verizon DBIR.

children.name: Networking & Meetups
children.description: Engage on LinkedIn, join OWASP chapters, CTFs, BSides events.
